result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Seger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew D. Seger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew D. Seger was found guilty of Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Matthew D. Seger was found guilty of Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $12790.00 plus surcharges.   
May not possess any weapons, including firearms. 
*  Pay Extradition fees of $288.36.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Any inmate account is subject to collection of restitution.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 13 years WSP; 8 years initial confinement w/credit for 413 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 13 years WSP consecutive to ct 1; 8 years initial confinement; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP; deft is not eligible for CIP; restitution ordered in the amount of $12,790 (by stipulation of deft); extradition costs ordered in the amount of $288.36; deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge; any inmate account is subject to collection of restitution.
2nd PSI has Judge's notes on it.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 3 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI odered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/4/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  JSH 7/24/15 at 8:15am to see if deft is accepting the plea agreement; JS set for 10/5/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Atty Laura Walker
granting motion to withdraw as attorney of record; Atty Barth is allowed to withdraw as attorney of record.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  Atty Barth moves to withdraw.  Court allows Atty Barth to withdraw, new PD to be appointed.  STC 6/25/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Graveley states the deft is rejecting the State's offer, is withdrawing the offer at this time.  Ludwig hearing held.  JS remains set for 6/8/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states they are working toward resolving the case.  ADA Graveley states the offer is only open until 3/20/15.  STC 3/20/15 at 9:30am and JS 6/8/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
